metadata.title: Functional Groups Database
metadata.description: Functional groups for chemical structures with enhanced information including ChEBI IDs and descriptions.

functional_groups.name: acid anhydride
functional_groups.description: Two acyl groups connected by oxygen

functional_groups.name: alkane
functional_groups.description: Saturated hydrocarbon with single bonds only
functional_groups.chebi_description: An acyclic branched or unbranched hydrocarbon having the general formula CnH2n+2, and therefore consisting entirely of hydrogen atoms and saturated carbon atoms.

functional_groups.name: alkyne
functional_groups.chebi_description: Acyclic branched or unbranched hydrocarbons having a carbon-carbon triple bond and the general formula CnH2n-2, RC#CR.

functional_groups.name: amidine
functional_groups.chebi_description: Derivatives of oxoacids RnE(=O)OH in which the hydroxy group is replaced by an amino group and the oxo group is replaced by =NR. In organic chemistry an unspecified amidine is commonly a carboxamidine.

functional_groups.name: ammonia
functional_groups.chebi_description: An azane that consists of a single nitrogen atom covelently bonded to three hydrogen atoms.

functional_groups.name: azide
functional_groups.description: Three nitrogen atoms in linear arrangement

functional_groups.name: boronate
functional_groups.chebi_description: A salt or ester of boronic acid.

functional_groups.name: alpha-haloketone
functional_groups.chebi_description: A haloketone in which the halogen and oxo substituents are on adjacent carbon atoms.

functional_groups.name: methyl ketone
functional_groups.chebi_description: A ketone of formula RC(=O)CH3 (R =/= H).

functional_groups.name: alpha-hydroxy ketone
functional_groups.chebi_description: An alpha-oxyketone that has a hydroxy group as the alpha-oxy moiety.

functional_groups.name: thioester
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound of general formula RC(=O)SR'. Compare with thionoester, RC(=S)OR'.

functional_groups.name: cinnamic acids
functional_groups.description: Aromatic ring with acrylate side chain

functional_groups.name: alkylbenzene
functional_groups.chebi_description: A  monocyclic arene that is benzene substituted with one or more alkyl groups.

functional_groups.name: benzenes
functional_groups.chebi_description: Any benzenoid aromatic compound consisting of the benzene skeleton and its substituted derivatives.

functional_groups.name: toluenes
functional_groups.chebi_description: Any member of the class of benzenes that is a substituted benzene in which the substituents include one (and only one) methyl group.

functional_groups.name: nitrotoluene
functional_groups.chebi_description: Any member of the class of  toluenes bearing one or more nitro substituents on the benzene ring.

functional_groups.name: phenol
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic hydroxy compound that consists of benzene bearing a single hydroxy substituent. The parent of the class of phenols.

functional_groups.name: indolin-2-one
functional_groups.chebi_description: An indolinone carrying an oxo group at position 2.

functional_groups.name: thiazoles
functional_groups.description: Five-membered ring with sulfur and nitrogen
functional_groups.chebi_description: An azole in which the five-membered heterocyclic aromatic skeleton contains a N atom and one S atom.

functional_groups.name: cyclohexadiene
functional_groups.description: Six-membered ring with two double bonds

functional_groups.name: haloarene
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound derived from an arene by replacing a hydrogen atom with a halogen atom.

functional_groups.name: hemiacetal
functional_groups.description: Carbon with OH and OR groups
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound having the general formula RR'C(OH)OR'' (R'' =/= H).

functional_groups.name: isocyanide
functional_groups.chebi_description: The isomer HN(+)#C(-) of hydrocyanic acid, HC#N, and its hydrocarbyl derivatives RNC (RN(+)#C(-)).

functional_groups.name: 1,2,3-triazole
functional_groups.description: Five-membered ring with three adjacent nitrogens

functional_groups.name: acetal
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organooxygen compound having the structure RR'C(OR'')(OR''') (R'', R''' =/= H). Mixed acetals have R'' and R''' groups which differ.

functional_groups.name: ester
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound formally derived from an oxoacid RkE(=O)l(OH)m (l > 0) and an alcohol, phenol, heteroarenol, or enol by linking with formal loss of water from an acidic hydroxy group of the former and a hydroxy group of the latter.

functional_groups.name: phosphonic ester
functional_groups.chebi_description: A phosphonic acid derivative in which one or both OH groups have been esterified.

functional_groups.name: ether
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organooxygen compound with formula ROR, where R is not hydrogen.

functional_groups.name: methoxy group
functional_groups.chebi_description: A methoxy group is a functional group with the formula -OCH3, consisting of a methyl group (-CH3) bonded to an oxygen atom.

functional_groups.name: aromatic ether
functional_groups.chebi_description: Ethers ROR' where R has an aromatic ring.

functional_groups.name: enol ether
functional_groups.chebi_description: Ethers ROR' where R has a double bond adjacent to the oxygen of the ether linkage.

functional_groups.name: silyl ether
functional_groups.chebi_description: Ethers ROR' where R' has the structure SiR''R'''R''''.

functional_groups.name: alkylphosphonate
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic phosphonate containing a C-PO(OH)2 or C-PO(OR)2  group (where R = alkyl group).

functional_groups.name: aminophosphonate
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic phosphonate of formula (RO)2P(=O)-CR2-NR2; R can be H.

functional_groups.name: phenylsilane
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organosilicon compound that is benzene in which a hydrogen is replaced by a silyl group.

functional_groups.name: silyl ether
functional_groups.chebi_description: Ethers ROR' where R' has the structure SiR''R'''R''''.

functional_groups.name: aminoxyls
functional_groups.chebi_description: Radicals derived from hydroxylamines by removal of the hydrogen atom from the hydroxy group. The synonymous terms nitroxyl radicals and nitroxides erroneously suggest the presence of a nitro group.

functional_groups.name: sulfanyl
functional_groups.chebi_description: A sulfur hydride that has formula HS.

functional_groups.name: triphenylphosphine
functional_groups.description: Phosphorus with three phenyl groups attached.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A member of the class of tertiary phosphines that is phosphane in which the three hydrogens are replaced by phenyl groups.

functional_groups.name: thiol
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organosulfur compound in which a thiol group, -SH, is attached to a carbon atom of any aliphatic or aromatic moiety.

functional_groups.name: triphenylphosphane oxide
functional_groups.description: Phosphine oxide with three phenyl groups

functional_groups.name: dinitrogen
functional_groups.chebi_description: An elemental molecule consisting of two trivalently-bonded nitrogen atoms.

functional_groups.name: pyranone
functional_groups.chebi_description: Any of a class of cyclic chemical compounds that contain an unsaturated six-membered ring with one ring oxygen atom and an oxo substituent.

functional_groups.name: aromatic compound
functional_groups.chebi_description: A cyclically conjugated molecular entity with a stability (due to delocalization) significantly greater than that of a hypothetical localized structure (e.g. Kekule structure) is said to possess aromatic character.

functional_groups.name: carboxylic anhydride
functional_groups.description: Two carbonyl groups connected by oxygen

functional_groups.name: diarylmethane
functional_groups.description: Methylene group connecting two aromatic rings
functional_groups.chebi_description: Any compound containing two aryl groups connected by a single C atom.

functional_groups.name: halohydrocarbon
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound derived from a hydrocarbon by replacing a hydrogen atom with a halogen atom.

functional_groups.name: halomethane
functional_groups.description: Methane with one or more halogen substituents
functional_groups.chebi_description: A haloalkane that is methane in which one (or more) of the hydrogens have been replaced by a halogen atom/halogen atoms.

functional_groups.name: lactone
functional_groups.description: Cyclic ester - an ester functional group where the carbonyl carbon and the oxygen-bonded carbon are connected through a chain of atoms to form a ring

functional_groups.name: organic sulfide
functional_groups.description: Sulfur atom bonded to two carbon atoms
functional_groups.chebi_description: Compounds having the structure RSR (R =/= H). Such compounds were once called thioethers.

functional_groups.name: organolithium compound
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound containing at least one carbon-lithium bond.

functional_groups.name: organomagnesium compound
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound containing at least one carbon-magnesium bond.

functional_groups.name: organozinc compound
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound containing at least one carbon-zinc bond.

functional_groups.name: oxyketone
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound with the general formula R2C=O (R=/=H) where one or more of the R groups contains an oxy (-O-) group.

functional_groups.name: propane-1,3-dithiol
functional_groups.description: Propane with thiol groups at positions 1 and 3
functional_groups.chebi_description: A dithiol that is propane substituted by thiol groups at positions 1 ans 3.

functional_groups.name: silyl enol ether
functional_groups.description: Enol ether with silicon protecting group
functional_groups.chebi_description: Enol ethers ROR' where R' has the structure SiR''R'''R''''.

functional_groups.name: methyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: methyl group

functional_groups.name: imino group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: imino group

functional_groups.name: acyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: acyl group

functional_groups.name: allyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: allyl group

functional_groups.name: hydrocarbyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: hydrocarbyl group

functional_groups.name: sulfonyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: sulfonyl group

functional_groups.name: phenyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: phenyl group

functional_groups.name: silyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: silyl group

functional_groups.name: halo group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: halo group

functional_groups.name: alkyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: alkyl group

functional_groups.name: organyl group
functional_groups.definition: Functional group from RXNO: organyl group

functional_groups.name: (11Z)-icos-11-enoyl group
functional_groups.description: An icosenoyl group derived from (11Z)-icos-11-enoic acid (gondoic acid).
functional_groups.chebi_description: An icosenoyl group derived from (11Z)-icos-11-enoic acid (gondoic acid).

functional_groups.name: 2'-hydroxyphenyl-2-thiazoline-4-oyl group
functional_groups.description: A univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of OH from the carboxy group of 2-(2-hydroxyphenyl)-4,5-dihydro-1,3-thiazole-4-carboxylic acid; an intermediate of pyochelin biosynthesis (bound to carrier protein).
functional_groups.chebi_description: A univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of OH from the carboxy group of 2-(2-hydroxyphenyl)-4,5-dihydro-1,3-thiazole-4-carboxylic acid; an intermediate of pyochelin biosynthesis (bound to carrier protein).

functional_groups.name: N-acetylneuraminyl group
functional_groups.description: A sialosyl group derived from N-acetylneuraminic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A sialosyl group derived from N-acetylneuraminic acid.

functional_groups.name: acetamide
functional_groups.description: A member of the class of acetamides that results from the formal condensation of acetic acid with ammonia.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A member of the class of acetamides that results from the formal condensation of acetic acid with ammonia.

functional_groups.name: acetate
functional_groups.description: A monocarboxylic acid anion resulting from the removal of a proton from the carboxy group of acetic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A monocarboxylic acid anion resulting from the removal of a proton from the carboxy group of acetic acid.

functional_groups.name: acetyl
functional_groups.description: An organic radical derived from  acetaldehyde.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic radical derived from  acetaldehyde.

functional_groups.name: acridine
functional_groups.description: A polycyclic heteroarene that is anthracene in which one of the central CH groups is replaced by a nitrogen atom.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A polycyclic heteroarene that is anthracene in which one of the central CH groups is replaced by a nitrogen atom.

functional_groups.name: all-trans-retinyl group
functional_groups.description: A prenyl group obtained by removal of the hydroxy group from all-trans-retinol.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A prenyl group obtained by removal of the hydroxy group from all-trans-retinol.

functional_groups.name: amidyl group
functional_groups.description: The substituent group formed by loss of a proton from azanide.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The substituent group formed by loss of a proton from azanide.

functional_groups.name: aminoguanidine
functional_groups.description: A one-carbon compound whose unique structure renders it capable of acting as a derivative of hydrazine, guanidine or formamide.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A one-carbon compound whose unique structure renders it capable of acting as a derivative of hydrazine, guanidine or formamide.

functional_groups.name: aniline
functional_groups.description: A primary arylamine in which an amino functional group is substituted for one of the benzene hydrogens.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A primary arylamine in which an amino functional group is substituted for one of the benzene hydrogens.

functional_groups.name: anthracene
functional_groups.description: An ortho-fused tricyclic hydrocarbon comprising three fused benzene rings.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An ortho-fused tricyclic hydrocarbon comprising three fused benzene rings.

functional_groups.name: benzene
functional_groups.description: A six-carbon aromatic annulene in which each carbon atom donates one of its two 2p electrons into a delocalised pi system. A toxic, flammable liquid byproduct of coal distillation, it is used as an industrial solvent. Benzene is a carcinogen that also damages bone marrow and the central nervous system.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A six-carbon aromatic annulene in which each carbon atom donates one of its two 2p electrons into a delocalised pi system. A toxic, flammable liquid byproduct of coal distillation, it is used as an industrial solvent. Benzene is a carcinogen that also damages bone marrow and the central nervous system.

functional_groups.name: benzidine
functional_groups.description: A member of the class of biphenyls that is 1,1'-biphenyl in which the hydrogen at the para-position of each phenyl group has been replaced by an amino group.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A member of the class of biphenyls that is 1,1'-biphenyl in which the hydrogen at the para-position of each phenyl group has been replaced by an amino group.

functional_groups.name: benzoyl group
functional_groups.description: The aroyl group formed by loss of OH from the carboxy group of benzoic acid; used as a protecting group in organic synthesis.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The aroyl group formed by loss of OH from the carboxy group of benzoic acid; used as a protecting group in organic synthesis.

functional_groups.name: benzylamine
functional_groups.description: A primary amine compound having benzyl as the N-substituent. It has been isolated from  Moringa oleifera (horseradish tree).
functional_groups.chebi_description: A primary amine compound having benzyl as the N-substituent. It has been isolated from  Moringa oleifera (horseradish tree).

functional_groups.name: biphenyl
functional_groups.description: A benzenoid aromatic compound that consists of two benzene rings connected by a single covalent bond. Biphenyl occurs naturally in coal tar, crude oil, and natural gas. Formerly used as a fungicide for citrus crops.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A benzenoid aromatic compound that consists of two benzene rings connected by a single covalent bond. Biphenyl occurs naturally in coal tar, crude oil, and natural gas. Formerly used as a fungicide for citrus crops.

functional_groups.name: borane
functional_groups.description: The simplest borane, consisting of a single boron atom carrying three hydrogens.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The simplest borane, consisting of a single boron atom carrying three hydrogens.

functional_groups.name: boryl group
functional_groups.description: A univalent group of formula BRR' (where R or R' can be H) with the free valency at the boron atom.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A univalent group of formula BRR' (where R or R' can be H) with the free valency at the boron atom.

functional_groups.name: carboxyacetyl group
functional_groups.description: The univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of -OH from one of the carboxy groups of malonic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of -OH from one of the carboxy groups of malonic acid.

functional_groups.name: chloride
functional_groups.description: A halide anion formed when chlorine picks up an electron to form an an anion.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A halide anion formed when chlorine picks up an electron to form an an anion.
common_reactions: carboxylic acid to acid chloride conversion

functional_groups.name: cyanide
functional_groups.description: A pseudohalide anion that is the conjugate base of hydrogen cyanide.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A pseudohalide anion that is the conjugate base of hydrogen cyanide.

functional_groups.name: cyclopropane
functional_groups.description: A cycloalkane composed of three carbon atoms to form a ring.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A cycloalkane composed of three carbon atoms to form a ring.

functional_groups.name: cyclopropanol
functional_groups.description: A cyclopropane in which a hydrogen atom is replaced by a hydroxy group.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A cyclopropane in which a hydrogen atom is replaced by a hydroxy group.

functional_groups.name: cyclopropylamine
functional_groups.description: A primary aliphatic amine that consists of cyclopropane bearing a single amino substituent.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A primary aliphatic amine that consists of cyclopropane bearing a single amino substituent.

functional_groups.name: cytosin1-yl group
functional_groups.description: An organic group obtained by removal of the hydrogen attached to the nitrogen at position 1 from cytosine.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic group obtained by removal of the hydrogen attached to the nitrogen at position 1 from cytosine.

functional_groups.name: dichloromethane
functional_groups.description: A member of the class of chloromethanes that is methane in which two of the hydrogens have been replaced by chlorine. A dense, non-flammible colourless liquid at room temperature (b.p. 40degreeC, d = 1.33) which is immiscible with water, it is widely used as a solvent, a paint stripper, and for the removal of caffeine from coffee and tea.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A member of the class of chloromethanes that is methane in which two of the hydrogens have been replaced by chlorine. A dense, non-flammible colourless liquid at room temperature (b.p. 40degreeC, d = 1.33) which is immiscible with water, it is widely used as a solvent, a paint stripper, and for the removal of caffeine from coffee and tea.

functional_groups.name: dodecanoyl group
functional_groups.description: A fatty-acyl group derived from dodecanoic (lauric) acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A fatty-acyl group derived from dodecanoic (lauric) acid.

functional_groups.name: enamine
functional_groups.description: An amine RNR'R'' where R has a double bond adjacent to the amine nitrogen.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An amine RNR'R'' where R has a double bond adjacent to the amine nitrogen.

functional_groups.name: enolate
functional_groups.description: An organic anion arising from deprotonation of the hydroxy group of an enol.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic anion arising from deprotonation of the hydroxy group of an enol.

functional_groups.name: enoyl group
functional_groups.description: Acyl groups derived from alkenoic acids.
functional_groups.chebi_description: Acyl groups derived from alkenoic acids.

functional_groups.name: ethanol
functional_groups.description: A primary alcohol that is ethane in which one of the hydrogens is substituted by a hydroxy group.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A primary alcohol that is ethane in which one of the hydrogens is substituted by a hydroxy group.

functional_groups.name: ethyl
functional_groups.description: An organic radical derived from ethane.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic radical derived from ethane.

functional_groups.name: flavonol
functional_groups.description: A monohydroxyflavone that is the 3-hydroxy derivative of flavone.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A monohydroxyflavone that is the 3-hydroxy derivative of flavone.

functional_groups.name: formamide
functional_groups.description: The simplest monocarboxylic acid amide, obtained by formal condensation of formic acid with ammonia. The parent of the class of formaldehydes.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The simplest monocarboxylic acid amide, obtained by formal condensation of formic acid with ammonia. The parent of the class of formaldehydes.

functional_groups.name: formate
functional_groups.description: A monocarboxylic acid anion that is the conjugate base of formic acid. Induces severe metabolic acidosis and ocular injury in human subjects.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A monocarboxylic acid anion that is the conjugate base of formic acid. Induces severe metabolic acidosis and ocular injury in human subjects.

functional_groups.name: furfuryl group
functional_groups.description: The substituent group formed from furfuryl alcohol.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The substituent group formed from furfuryl alcohol.

functional_groups.name: glycerol
functional_groups.description: A triol with a structure of propane substituted at positions 1, 2 and 3 by hydroxy groups.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A triol with a structure of propane substituted at positions 1, 2 and 3 by hydroxy groups.

functional_groups.name: hexamethylenetetramine
functional_groups.description: A polycyclic cage that is adamantane in which the carbon atoms at positions 1, 3, 5 and 7 are replaced by nitrogen atoms.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A polycyclic cage that is adamantane in which the carbon atoms at positions 1, 3, 5 and 7 are replaced by nitrogen atoms.

functional_groups.name: hydride
functional_groups.description: The general name for the hydrogen anion H(-), to be used without regard to the hydrogen nuclear mass (either for hydrogen in its natural abundance or where it is not desired to distinguish between the isotopes).
functional_groups.chebi_description: The general name for the hydrogen anion H(-), to be used without regard to the hydrogen nuclear mass (either for hydrogen in its natural abundance or where it is not desired to distinguish between the isotopes).

functional_groups.name: hydroxylamine
functional_groups.description: The simplest hydroxylamine, consisting of ammonia bearing a hydroxy substituent. It is an intermediate in the biological nitrification by microbes like bacteria.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The simplest hydroxylamine, consisting of ammonia bearing a hydroxy substituent. It is an intermediate in the biological nitrification by microbes like bacteria.

functional_groups.name: icosanoyl group
functional_groups.description: A fatty-acyl group derived from icosanoic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A fatty-acyl group derived from icosanoic acid.

functional_groups.name: imidate
functional_groups.description: A compound with the general formula R'-N=C(OR)R'' where R is organyl and R' and R'' can be organyl or H.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A compound with the general formula R'-N=C(OR)R'' where R is organyl and R' and R'' can be organyl or H.

functional_groups.name: imine
functional_groups.description: Compounds having the structure RN=CR2 (R = H, hydrocarbyl). Thus analogues of aldehydes or ketones, having NR doubly bonded to carbon; aldimines have the structure RCH=NR, ketimines have the structure R'2C=NR (where R' is not H). Imines include azomethines and Schiff bases. Imine is used as a suffix in systematic nomenclature to denote the C=NH group excluding the carbon atom.
functional_groups.chebi_description: Compounds having the structure RN=CR2 (R = H, hydrocarbyl). Thus analogues of aldehydes or ketones, having NR doubly bonded to carbon; aldimines have the structure RCH=NR, ketimines have the structure R'2C=NR (where R' is not H). Imines include azomethines and Schiff bases. Imine is used as a suffix in systematic nomenclature to denote the C=NH group excluding the carbon atom.

functional_groups.name: isoquinoline
functional_groups.description: An ortho-fused heteroarene that is a benzopyridine in which the N atom not directly attached to the benzene ring.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An ortho-fused heteroarene that is a benzopyridine in which the N atom not directly attached to the benzene ring.

functional_groups.name: isothiocyanate
functional_groups.description: An organosulfur compound with the general formula R-N=C=S.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organosulfur compound with the general formula R-N=C=S.

functional_groups.name: ketene
functional_groups.description: Carbonyl compounds where the C=O bond is conjugated to an alkylidene group.
functional_groups.chebi_description: Carbonyl compounds where the C=O bond is conjugated to an alkylidene group.

functional_groups.name: lipoyl group
functional_groups.description: A univalent carboacyl group that is derived from 5-(1,2-dithiolan-3-yl)pentanoic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A univalent carboacyl group that is derived from 5-(1,2-dithiolan-3-yl)pentanoic acid.

functional_groups.name: methanol
functional_groups.description: The primary alcohol that is the simplest aliphatic alcohol, comprising a methyl and an alcohol group.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The primary alcohol that is the simplest aliphatic alcohol, comprising a methyl and an alcohol group.

functional_groups.name: methoxide
functional_groups.description: An organic anion that is the conjugate base of methanol.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organic anion that is the conjugate base of methanol.

functional_groups.name: nitrate
functional_groups.description: A nitrogen oxoanion formed by loss of a proton from nitric acid. Principal species present at pH 7.3.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A nitrogen oxoanion formed by loss of a proton from nitric acid. Principal species present at pH 7.3.

functional_groups.name: nitrosamine
functional_groups.description: N-Nitroso amines, compounds of the structure R2NNO. Compounds RNHNO are not ordinarily isolable, but they, too, are nitrosamines. The name is a contraction of N-nitrosoamine and, as such, does not require the N locant.
functional_groups.chebi_description: N-Nitroso amines, compounds of the structure R2NNO. Compounds RNHNO are not ordinarily isolable, but they, too, are nitrosamines. The name is a contraction of N-nitrosoamine and, as such, does not require the N locant.

functional_groups.name: nosyl group
functional_groups.description: A sulfonyl group having 4-nitrophenyl as the S-substituent.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A sulfonyl group having 4-nitrophenyl as the S-substituent.

functional_groups.name: nucleoside
functional_groups.description: An N-glycosyl compound that has both a nucleobase, normally adenine, guanine, xanthine, thymine, cytosine or uracil, and either a ribose or deoxyribose as functional parents.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An N-glycosyl compound that has both a nucleobase, normally adenine, guanine, xanthine, thymine, cytosine or uracil, and either a ribose or deoxyribose as functional parents.

functional_groups.name: octanoyl group
functional_groups.description: The univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of -OH from the carboxy group of octanoic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of -OH from the carboxy group of octanoic acid.

functional_groups.name: organosilyl group
functional_groups.description: An organyl derivative of the silyl group, R3Si-.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organyl derivative of the silyl group, R3Si-.

functional_groups.name: oxetane
functional_groups.description: A saturated organic heteromonocyclic parent that is a four-membered ring comprising of three carbon atoms and an oxygen atom.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A saturated organic heteromonocyclic parent that is a four-membered ring comprising of three carbon atoms and an oxygen atom.

functional_groups.name: permanganate
common_reactions: secondary, non-terminal alkene oxidation to aldehydes
tertiary alkene oxidation to carboxylic acid and ketone
secondary terminal alkene oxidation to ketone and carbon dioxide
primary alkene oxidation to carboxylic acid and carbon dioxide

functional_groups.name: petroselaidoyl group
functional_groups.description: An octadec-6-enoyl group in which the olefinic double bond has E configuration.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An octadec-6-enoyl group in which the olefinic double bond has E configuration.

functional_groups.name: petroselinoyl group
functional_groups.description: An octadec-6-enoyl group in which the olefinic double bond has Z configuration.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An octadec-6-enoyl group in which the olefinic double bond has Z configuration.

functional_groups.name: phenolate
functional_groups.description: A phenolate anion that is the conjugate base of phenol obtained by deprotonation of the OH group.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A phenolate anion that is the conjugate base of phenol obtained by deprotonation of the OH group.

functional_groups.name: phosgene
functional_groups.description: An acyl chloride obtained by substitution of both hydrogens of formaldehyde by chlorine.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An acyl chloride obtained by substitution of both hydrogens of formaldehyde by chlorine.

functional_groups.name: phosphatidyl group
functional_groups.description: An acyl group derived from a phosphatidic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An acyl group derived from a phosphatidic acid.

functional_groups.name: phthalimide
functional_groups.description: A  dicarboximide that is 2,3-dihydro-1H-isoindole substituted by oxo groups at positions 1 and 3.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A  dicarboximide that is 2,3-dihydro-1H-isoindole substituted by oxo groups at positions 1 and 3.

functional_groups.name: phthaloyl group
functional_groups.description: A divalent carboacyl group formed by removal of an OH from each carboxyl group of phthalic acid. It has been used as an amino protecting group of deoxyadenosine in oligonucleotide synthesis.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A divalent carboacyl group formed by removal of an OH from each carboxyl group of phthalic acid. It has been used as an amino protecting group of deoxyadenosine in oligonucleotide synthesis.

functional_groups.name: phthalyl group
functional_groups.description: A univalent carboacyl group formed by removal of an OH from one of the carboxyl groups of phthalic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A univalent carboacyl group formed by removal of an OH from one of the carboxyl groups of phthalic acid.

functional_groups.name: pinacol
functional_groups.description: A glycol that is ethylene glycol in which all four methylene hydrogens have been replaced by methyl groups.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A glycol that is ethylene glycol in which all four methylene hydrogens have been replaced by methyl groups.

functional_groups.name: piperazine
functional_groups.description: An azacycloalkane that consists of a six-membered ring containing two nitrogen atoms at opposite positions.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An azacycloalkane that consists of a six-membered ring containing two nitrogen atoms at opposite positions.

functional_groups.name: piperidine
functional_groups.description: An azacycloalkane that is cyclohexane in which one of the carbons is replaced by a nitrogen. It is a metabolite of cadaverine, a polyamine found in the human intestine.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An azacycloalkane that is cyclohexane in which one of the carbons is replaced by a nitrogen. It is a metabolite of cadaverine, a polyamine found in the human intestine.

functional_groups.name: pivalate
functional_groups.description: A monocarboxylic acid anion resulting from the removal of a proton from the carboxy group of pivalic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A monocarboxylic acid anion resulting from the removal of a proton from the carboxy group of pivalic acid.

functional_groups.name: primary amino group
functional_groups.description: An amino group formed by replacement of one of the hydrogen atoms in ammonia by a group or atom other than a hydrogen atom.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An amino group formed by replacement of one of the hydrogen atoms in ammonia by a group or atom other than a hydrogen atom.

functional_groups.name: prop-2-yn-1-yl group
functional_groups.description: A propynyl group with the free valence at the singly-bonded carbon.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A propynyl group with the free valence at the singly-bonded carbon.

functional_groups.name: pyrimidine
functional_groups.description: The parent compound of the pyrimidines; a diazine having the two nitrogens at the 1- and 3-positions.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The parent compound of the pyrimidines; a diazine having the two nitrogens at the 1- and 3-positions.

functional_groups.name: pyrrolidine
functional_groups.description: A cyclic amine whose five-membered ring contains four carbon atoms and one nitrogen atom; the parent compound of the pyrrolidine family.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A cyclic amine whose five-membered ring contains four carbon atoms and one nitrogen atom; the parent compound of the pyrrolidine family.

functional_groups.name: quinazoline
functional_groups.description: A mancude organic heterobicyclic parent that is naphthalene in which the carbon atoms at positions 1 and 3 have been replaced by nitrogen atoms.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A mancude organic heterobicyclic parent that is naphthalene in which the carbon atoms at positions 1 and 3 have been replaced by nitrogen atoms.

functional_groups.name: quinoline
functional_groups.description: The simplest member of the quinoline class of compounds, comprising a benzene ring ortho fused to C-2 and C-3 of a pyridine ring.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The simplest member of the quinoline class of compounds, comprising a benzene ring ortho fused to C-2 and C-3 of a pyridine ring.

functional_groups.name: quinoxaline
functional_groups.description: A naphthyridine in which the nitrogens are at positions 1 and 4.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A naphthyridine in which the nitrogens are at positions 1 and 4.

functional_groups.name: semicarbazide
functional_groups.description: A monocarboxylic acid amide that is urea where one of the amino groups has been replaced with hydrazine.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A monocarboxylic acid amide that is urea where one of the amino groups has been replaced with hydrazine.

functional_groups.name: silane
functional_groups.description: The simplest silane, consisting of a single silicon atom carrying four hydrogens.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The simplest silane, consisting of a single silicon atom carrying four hydrogens.

functional_groups.name: sulfate
functional_groups.description: A sulfur oxoanion obtained by deprotonation of both OH groups of sulfuric acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A sulfur oxoanion obtained by deprotonation of both OH groups of sulfuric acid.

functional_groups.name: sulfonate
functional_groups.description: The sulfur oxoanion formed by deprotonation of sulfonic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The sulfur oxoanion formed by deprotonation of sulfonic acid.
common_reactions: obsolete: bromo Heck-type reaction/sulfonate ester Finkelstein reaction

functional_groups.name: thiophene
functional_groups.description: A monocyclic heteroarene that is furan in which the oxygen atom is replaced by a sulfur.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A monocyclic heteroarene that is furan in which the oxygen atom is replaced by a sulfur.

functional_groups.name: toluene
functional_groups.description: The simplest member of the class toluenes consisting of a benzene core which bears a single methyl substituent.
functional_groups.chebi_description: The simplest member of the class toluenes consisting of a benzene core which bears a single methyl substituent.

functional_groups.name: tosyl group
functional_groups.description: A group, usually derived from the compound 4-toluenesulfonyl chloride, which forms esters and amides of toluenesulfonic acid; often used as a protecting group for alcohols and amines in organic synthesis reactions.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A group, usually derived from the compound 4-toluenesulfonyl chloride, which forms esters and amides of toluenesulfonic acid; often used as a protecting group for alcohols and amines in organic synthesis reactions.

functional_groups.name: triethylamine
functional_groups.description: A tertiary amine that is ammonia in which each hydrogen atom is substituted by an ethyl group.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A tertiary amine that is ammonia in which each hydrogen atom is substituted by an ethyl group.

functional_groups.name: triflate
functional_groups.description: An organosulfonate oxoanion resulting from the removal of a proton from the sulfonic acid group of triflic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organosulfonate oxoanion resulting from the removal of a proton from the sulfonic acid group of triflic acid.

functional_groups.name: trifluoroacetyl group
functional_groups.description: A univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of OH from the carboxy group of trifluoroacetic acid.
functional_groups.chebi_description: A univalent carboacyl group formed by loss of OH from the carboxy group of trifluoroacetic acid.

functional_groups.name: triflyl group
common_reactions: obsolete: triflyloxy Heck reaction/bromide Finkelstein reaction

functional_groups.name: trimethylsilyl group
functional_groups.description: An organosilyl group consisting of three methyl groups bonded to a silicon atom with a free valence on silicon for bonding to the rest of a molecule.
functional_groups.chebi_description: An organosilyl group consisting of three methyl groups bonded to a silicon atom with a free valence on silicon for bonding to the rest of a molecule.

chebi_entities.name: sulfonyl group
chebi_entities.definition: A group obtained by deletion of the hydroxyl group from the sulfonyl group of a sulfonic acid.

chebi_entities.name: halogen
chebi_entities.definition: A halogen atom (fluorine, chlorine, bromine, or iodine).

chebi_entities.name: alkyl group
chebi_entities.definition: A univalent group derived from an alkane by removal of a hydrogen atom.

chebi_entities.name: acyl group
chebi_entities.definition: A group obtained by removing the hydroxyl group from the carboxy group of a carboxylic acid.

chebi_entities.name: allyl group
chebi_entities.definition: The univalent carboacyl group CH2=CH-CH2- derived from propene.

chebi_entities.name: hydrocarbyl group
chebi_entities.definition: A univalent group formed by removing a hydrogen atom from a hydrocarbon.

chebi_entities.name: silyl group
chebi_entities.definition: A univalent group derived from silane by removal of a hydrogen atom.

chebi_entities.name: imino group
chebi_entities.definition: A divalent group formally derived from ammonia by removal of two hydrogen atoms.
